title: 115_s3254
content: The Act may be cited as the "Eliminating Kickbacks in Recovery Act of 2018" and includes criminal penalties. The "Eliminating Kickbacks in Recovery Act of 2018" introduces criminal penalties for illegal remunerations involving referrals to recovery homes and clinical treatment facilities under section 220 of title 18, United States Code. This prohibits soliciting or receiving any remuneration for patient referrals and prohibits recovery homes or clinical treatment facilities from offering kickbacks. The "Eliminating Kickbacks in Recovery Act of 2018" prohibits offering or receiving remuneration for patient referrals to recovery homes or clinical treatment facilities. This includes any kickbacks, bribes, or rebates in exchange for referrals. The "Eliminating Kickbacks in Recovery Act of 2018" prohibits offering or receiving remuneration for patient referrals to recovery homes or clinical treatment facilities. Violators may face fines up to $200,000, imprisonment up to 10 years, or both. Exceptions include discounts properly disclosed under health care benefit programs and employer payments to employees for covered services. The employee's remuneration is not based on referrals to recovery homes or treatment facilities. Payments to purchasing agents must be specified in a written contract. Exceptions apply for discounts under health care benefit programs and employer payments for services. The curr_chunk discusses various types of remuneration, including disclosing vendor payments, discounts on drugs under Medicare, and payments to agents for services under specific contracts. The curr_chunk discusses waivers, discounts, and remuneration between health centers and entities providing goods or services to maintain availability. The curr_chunk discusses the intent requirement for violations related to maintaining or enhancing services for medically underserved populations. It also provides definitions for terms like applicable beneficiary, clinical treatment facility, and health care benefit program. The curr_chunk provides definitions for terms related to health care benefit programs and recovery homes. The curr_chunk addresses illegal remunerations for referrals to recovery homes and clinical treatment facilities.
